column4: I can't get my video applications to work ... vlc does't work -- openshot wont work and movie player won't work.
they open but will not play videos
ok do you have all of the codecs installed?
if you have sun java installed I would prefer you do this via  synaptic package manager
vlc should handle that well ..let me try one here hold on
well see if that remedies the problem  before you thank me :)
also ,, if you intend on playing dvds  you will need to run this command from the terminal        sudo /usr/share/doc/libdvdread4/install-css.sh
also you could install the w32codecs    do you have 32 or 64 bit system?
I managed to install the ubuntu-restricted-extras and still videos won't play.
mmm  which type of videos are these?  .avi   .ogg  ?
mm mpegs are playing here with vlc....
ok go here   http://packages.medibuntu.org/maverick/w32codecs.html   and at the bottom of the page  click the blue  i386  and download the w32codecs  then double click the package and install them
generally no...however  cant hurt if its not working....
